section.title: Introduction
section.p: Welcome to the Orbeon PresentationServer User Guide!

Orbeon PresentationServer is a J2EE-based MVC framework for building Web applications that present and capture XML using XForms, XSLT, and Web Services. PresentationServer benefits from standardized forms processing using XForms, rich controller semantics, and full-featured XML pipelines. PresentationServer is in fact built around Orbeon's optimized XML pipeline engine, a mature, high-performance engine for pipeline processing of XML. PresentationServer is ideal for building Composite Applications in a Service Oriented Architecture (SOA), an can be used on its own, or within the OIS suite.

section.title: Purpose of the User Guide
section.p: The purpose of this guide is to get users acquainted with the fundamental concepts of PresentationServer: XML processors and XML pipelines, the XML Pipeline Definition Language (XPL), XForms, the Page Flow Controller (PFC), and PresentationServer's built-in XML processors. It is highly recommended to quickly get to the Tutorial to get started with developing applications with PresentationServer.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: This guide should be accessible to anyone with some experience developing simple Web applications.
